title: Brendan Rodgers hits back at Jurgen Klopp over Mohamed Salah complaint
text:
Jurgen Klopp was furious with Hamza Choudhury for the challenge that left Mohamed Salah with an ankle injury (Picture: Getty)

Brendan Rodgers has hit back at Jurgen Klopp, claiming his criticism of Leicester City midfielder Hamza Choudhury was way over the top.

The England Under-21 international drew the ire of the Liverpool manager after his challenge on Mohamed Salah during the recent Premier League clash between the two teams with an ankle injury.

Despite a two-week rest during the international break, Salah had not recovered in time to feature in last Sunday’s 1-1 draw against Manchester United but is in contention to feature against Genk in the Champions League this evening.

Klopp, meanwhile, was furious with Choudhury and accused the 22-year-old of recklessness and warned the player he was in danger of earning a reputation having also been involved in an incident involving Newcastle’s Matt Ritchie last season.

Advertisement

Rodgers, however, was annoyed with Klopp’s reaction and insists he is a fan of Choudhury’s aggressive and combative nature.

Mo Salah missed Liverpool’s match against Man Utd after he suffered an injury as a consequence of Hamza Choudhury’s tackle (Picture: Getty)

‘The reaction to Hamza was right over the top for me,’ he said. ‘The boy went in to make a tackle.

‘Mo Salah is a world-class player but you can tackle him. It wasn’t even a bad tackle.

‘You have to ensure they stay aggressive because that is their game, without overstepping the line.

‘If you look at the team we play in an aggressive but sporting way.

‘Young Hamza is one of those lads that play on the limit and is fighting for his career.

‘His strength is recovering the ball and retrieving the ball, which he is very good at, and he is learning other aspects of his game.

‘The only way is constant work and talking with him.’
